title.narrative: 05-03 EDUCATION FOR OUT OF SCHOOL

description.narrative: 5.3. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access to education, especially to secondary education, for adolescent girls and marginalized children in targeted provinces., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5. By 2021, boys and girls of school-going age demonstrate improved learning outcomes as a result of equitable and inclusive access to quality education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.3. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have strengthened capacity to increase access toeducation, especially to secondary education, for adolescent girls and marginalized children in targeted provinces.

description.narrative: UNICEF has continued to strengthen the capacity of MoE in the provision of alternative remote learning, creation of safe and protective learning environment against COVID-19 pandemic and delivery of Catch-Up/remedial lessons to mitigate learning loss particularly among disadvantaged children. The capacity building of MoE in alternative mode of education provision is aimed at addressing the immediate need during school closure as well as expanding alternative and flexible access to Out-of-School Children. Over 500,000 disadvantaged children from the most resource deprived communities were able to return to a safe and protective school environment and are receiving Catch-Up/remedial lessons. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
